# Chord: Minor 6th in F# (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The Minor 6th chord in the key of F# (equivalent to the G shape on the guitar) consists of the notes F# (Root), A (minor 3rd), C# (5th), and D# (6th). This chord has a mood that can be described as melancholic, yet it also carries a sense of tension and intrigue due to the minor tonality and the augmented 6th interval.

## Notes and Intervals
- F# (Root)
- A (minor 3rd)
- C# (5th)
- D# (6th)

## Genre and Flavor
The Minor 6th chord in F# (G shape) is often used in Jazz, R&B, Soul, and Neo-Soul music. It adds a layer of sophistication and depth to chord progressions, offering a rich and evocative sound. The use of the minor 6th interval provides a touch of dissonance that can infuse a sense of drama or introspection into a musical piece.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Minor 6th chord in F# (G shape) prominently:
1. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones**: This song uses the Minor 6th chord in a beautifully laid-back Jazz-pop setting, enhancing the emotional depth of the music.
2. **"Rise Up" by Andra Day**: In this empowering Soul ballad, the Minor 6th chord adds a soulful and poignant quality to the chord progressions.
3. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: A classic Jazz composition that showcases the versatility of the Minor 6th chord in F# (G shape) within a modal Jazz context.
